      1. Intro quantarticR

      intro.Rmd

      Overview

      The quantarcticR package provides access to Quantarctica data sets for R users, without needing QGIS to be installed.

      This vignette:

      • explains what Quantarctica data is
      • shows how the datasets can be used in R
      • provides examples of how you can work with them

      What is Quantarctica?

      Quantarctica is a collection of Antarctic geographical datasets which works with the free, cross-platform, open-source software QGIS. It includes community-contributed, peer-reviewed data from ten different scientific themes and a professionally-designed basemap.

      Quantarctica is is published and made available under under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

      If you use a dataset, please cite it:

      Matsuoka K, Skoglund A, Roth G (2018) Quantarctica dataset. Norwegian Polar Institute. https://doi.org/10.21334/npolar.2018.8516e961

      Caching datasets

      The quantarcticR R package provides you with flexibility to either temporarily or persistently store the data.

      On loading the package, you will be provided with two options:

      1: Yes. Use a temporary cache directory for this session only
      2: No. Use the persistent cache directory

      …. Can you change to the other option after you have loaded the package?….

      … May need some add when to use which option …

      Quantarctica Data Sets

      library(quantarcticR)
      ## Quantarctica is made available under a CC-BY license.
## If you use it, please cite it:
## Matsuoka K, Skoglund A, Roth G (2018) Quantarctica [Data set]. Norwegian Polar Institute.
## https://doi.org/10.21334/npolar.2018.8516e961

      In order to return a list of the datasets available, use the qa_datasets function.

      datasets <- qa_datasets()
class(datasets)
      ## [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

      The list is of class tbl_df, tbl, data.frame which can also be used with tidyverse functions.

      head(datasets)
      ## # A tibble: 6 x 5
##   layername         main_file                   type   cached download_size
##   <chr>             <chr>                       <chr>  <lgl>    <fs::bytes>
## 1 Overview place n~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE         19.74K
## 2 COMNAP listed fa~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE        691.92K
## 3 Subantarctic sta~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE        691.92K
## 4 SCAR Composite g~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE        329.05M
## 5 IBO-IOC GEBCO Fe~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE          1.25M
## 6 IBO-IOC GEBCO Fe~ "C:\\Users\\Home\\AppData\~ shape~ FALSE          1.25M

      In the datasets object we can see the following:

      • layername which is the name of the dataset
      • type which is the object type shapefile or raster
      • cache whether cached or not
      • download_size which is the size of the layername dataset

      Dataset details

      In order to view the details of a dataset use the qa_dataset function for the simple basemap called “ADD Simple basemap”.

      dataset <- qa_dataset("ADD Simple basemap")
class(dataset)
      ## [1] "qa_dataset" "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

      …. is there a print or summary function for the qa_dataset object?….

      Fetch a dataset

      To fetch a dataset use the qa_get function with the dataset layername.

      Here fetch a dataset called “AntGG Free-air gravity anomaly (10km)”using the default options.

      gravity_anomaly <- qa_get("AntGG Free-air gravity anomaly (10km)", verbose = TRUE)
      ## 
## Thu Feb 21 12:53:08 2019
## Synchronizing dataset: AntGG Free-air gravity anomaly (10km)
## Source URL http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/
## --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
## 
##  this dataset path is: C:\Users\Home\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpKI6OzE\quantarcticR-cache/Geophysics//ANTGG
##  visiting http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ ... 7 download links, 0 links to visit done.
##  downloading file 1 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG.txt ...  done.
##  downloading file 2 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_Accuracy_10km.tif ...  done.
##  downloading file 3 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_Accuracy_10km.tif.aux.xml ...  done.
##  downloading file 4 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_BouguerAnomaly_10km.tif ...  done.
##  downloading file 5 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_BouguerAnomaly_10km.tif.aux.xml ...  done.
##  downloading file 6 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_FreeAirGravityAnomaly_10km.tif ...  done.
##  downloading file 7 of 7: http://quantarctica.tpac.org.au/Quantarctica3/Geophysics/ANTGG/ANTGG_FreeAirGravityAnomaly_10km.tif.aux.xml ...  done.
## 
## Thu Feb 21 12:53:13 2019 dataset synchronization complete: AntGG Free-air gravity anomaly (10km)
      class(gravity_anomaly)
      ## [1] "RasterLayer"
## attr(,"package")
## [1] "raster"

      Raster Plot

      Use the Raster package to plot gravity_anomaly.

      library(raster)
      ## Warning: package 'raster' was built under R version 3.5.2
      ## Loading required package: sp
      raster::plot(gravity_anomaly)

      Using datasets with sf

      Read in the simple basemap “ADD Simple basemap” data as an sf object and use the ggplot2 and sf packages to create a plot.

      library(sf)
      ## Warning: package 'sf' was built under R version 3.5.2
      ## Linking to GEOS 3.6.1, GDAL 2.2.3, PROJ 4.9.3
      library(ggplot2)
      ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.5.2
      surface_sf <- qa_get("ADD Simple basemap", shapefile_reader = sf::st_read)
      ## Reading layer `ADD_DerivedLowresBasemap' from data source `C:\Users\Home\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpKI6OzE\quantarcticR-cache\Miscellaneous\SimpleBasemap\ADD_DerivedLowresBasemap.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
## Simple feature collection with 1338 features and 1 field
## geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
## dimension:      XY
## bbox:           xmin: -5791904 ymin: -5791904 xmax: 5791904 ymax: 5791904
## epsg (SRID):    3031
## proj4string:    +proj=stere +lat_0=-90 +lat_ts=-71 +lon_0=0 +k=1 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs
      surface_sf
      ## Simple feature collection with 1338 features and 1 field
## geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
## dimension:      XY
## bbox:           xmin: -5791904 ymin: -5791904 xmax: 5791904 ymax: 5791904
## epsg (SRID):    3031
## proj4string:    +proj=stere +lat_0=-90 +lat_ts=-71 +lon_0=0 +k=1 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs

      surface_sf %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_sf()
